}} {{Album ratings |rev1 = Allmusic |rev1score = |title=United -
Commodores|publisher=Allmusic}} }} 'United' is the twelfth studio album by
the Commodores, released in 1986 as the follow-up to their extremely successful
album [[Nightshift (album)|Nightshift]] from the previous year. This album
included one of The Commodores' last significant hits in "Goin' to the Bank",
and it has been the group's last major charting album to date, even though they
went on to release several albums since. "Goin' to the Bank" climbed to number
two on Billboard's R&B singles chart. The follow-up single, "Take It From Me",
barely entered the top 40 on the R&B chart, while another single, the ballad
"United in Love", peaked at #22 on the Adult Contemporary chart. [http://www.allmusic.com/album/united-
mw0000189584/awards The Commodores- United - Awards (chart placements)
@AllMusic.com] Retrieved 3-3-2013.
